snippet: After election officials turned aside complaints of fraud in the March 9 presidential election, Salvador Sánchez Cerén, 69, a former leftist guerrilla commander in the country’s 12-year civil war, was officially declared the victor on Sunday...
abstract: Salvador Sanchez Ceren, former leftist guerrilla commander in El Salvador's 12-year civil war, is officially declared president after election officials turn aside complaints of fraud in country's presidential election.
lead_paragraph: After election officials turned aside complaints of fraud in the March 9 presidential election, Salvador Sánchez Cerén, 69, a former leftist guerrilla commander in the country’s 12-year civil war, was officially declared the victor on Sunday night.

headline.main: After a Final Challenge, Election Officials Declare a Winner in El Salvador
headline.print_headline: El Salvador: After a Final Challenge, Election Officials Declare a Winner
